metadata.name: Always Install Elevated MSI Spawned Cmd And Powershell
metadata.comment: Detects Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) spawning "cmd" or "powershell"

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\cmd.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\pwsh.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('cmd\.exe', 'powershell\.exe', 'pwsh\.dll')) AND contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\windows\\installer\\')) AND contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('msi')) AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('tmp')))

output.summary: Detects Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) spawning "cmd" or "powershell"

metadata.objective: Examine fields: process.name, process.parent_process.name False positive: Unknown Reference: https://image.slidesharecdn.com/kheirkhabarovoffzonefinal-181117201458/95/hunting-for-privilege-escalation-in-windows-environment-50-638.jpg
